definitions.definition: A thick cloud that forms near the ground; the obscurity of such a cloud.
A mist or film clouding a surface.
A state of mind characterized by lethargy and confusion.
definitions.example: He did so many drugs, he was still in a fog three months after going through detox.

definitions.definition: A silver deposit or other blur on a negative or developed photographic image.
To become covered with or as if with fog.
To become obscured in condensation or water.
definitions.example: The mirror fogged every time he showered.

definitions.definition: To cover with or as if with fog.
To disperse insecticide into (a forest canopy) so as to collect organisms.
To obscure in condensation or water.
To practice in a small or mean way; to pettifog.
A new growth of grass appearing on a field that has been mowed or grazed.
Tall and decaying grass left standing after the cutting or grazing season; foggage.
To pasture cattle on the fog, or aftergrass, of; to eat off the fog from.
To become covered with the kind of grass called fog.
